name: Blood Glucose Meter False Low Reading
description: Diagnostic glucose meter displayed falsely low reading leading to patient taking extra insulin and experiencing hypoglycemia. MDR required - malfunction could cause serious injury.

fields.event_description: Patient checked blood glucose before dinner using their GlucoCheck Pro meter. The meter displayed a reading of 52 mg/dL. Based on this reading, patient consumed 15g fast-acting carbs and reduced their dinner insulin dose. Approximately 1 hour later, patient felt symptoms of hyperglycemia and rechecked with a backup meter which showed 245 mg/dL. Patient then tested the original meter with control solution which showed the meter was reading approximately 100 mg/dL low. The patient's actual glucose at the time of the original reading was likely around 150 mg/dL, not 52 mg/dL. Patient had to take corrective insulin and experienced significant blood sugar fluctuations for the next several hours.
fields.patient_outcome: Hyperglycemia due to reduced insulin, blood sugar fluctuations

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A0201 (Device Displays Inaccurate Data) is the device problem - meter showed falsely low reading. C0902 (Hyperglycemia) is the patient outcome. This requires MDR because the malfunction (inaccurate glucose reading) could cause serious injury if it recurs - a patient could take too much insulin and experience severe hypoglycemia.

extraction_challenges: Need to infer relevant medical condition (diabetes) from context
Understanding the cause-effect chain (false low -> wrong treatment -> hyperglycemia)
notes: Tests understanding of diagnostic device failures and downstream patient effects. The malfunction itself didn't cause immediate severe harm, but could if it recurs.
